abstract: The aircraft maker submitted a bid for a $35 billion Air Force tanker contract and said it would cut costs on the production line to compete with its rival.
snippet: The aircraft maker submitted a bid for a $35 billion Air Force tanker contract and said it would cut costs on the production line to compete with its rival.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As Boeing filed its bid on Friday for a $35 billion Air Force tanker contract, the company said it was changing the production line of its 767 jets to cut costs and better compete with a rival bid.

headline.main: Boeing Bids for Tanker, and Overhauls 767 Production
headline.print_headline: Boeing Bids for Tanker, and Overhauls 767 Production
